Stage Results A RallyDataJunkie Adventure Preface Who This Review Is For

Stage Results A RallyDataJunkie Adventure Tony Hirst Last generated on 23 January, 2022 Preface Automatically generated stage timing and results for stages on Rallye Monte-Carlo, 2022. Based on analysis of timing and results data downloaded from the WRC website. To discuss / critique / comment on these analyses, please use the discussion forum. For a guide to the code used to generate the stage reports, see Visualising WRC Rally Results. See also Visualising WRC Rally Stages. This report is unofficial and is not associated in any way with the Fédération Internationale de l’Automobile (FIA) or WRC Promoter GmbH. Who This Review Is For The RallyDataJunkie project, such as it is, is a personal exploration of various ways of representing and visualising rally related stage, timing and results data. There are several potential audiences: rally fans, looking for summaries of rally events; teams and crews, looking for variously arranged summaries to check and compare performances; commentators and journalists, looking for variously arranged summaries and overviews as a tool for confirming or identifying storypoints; data folk, looking for various ways of representing various route, timing or results data.

Pace relative to the stage winner. 1.1.6 Ultimate Stage Comparisons Split time comparisons relative to various ultimate stage time calculations. These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives Comparisons Split time comparisons relative to various ultimate stage time calculations. These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 2.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times Stage report for SS2: OGI took the stage win and kept hold of the overall lead marking a time of 914.4s. LOE took second place on stage, with a time of 915.7s . EVA took third position on stage, with a time of 916.3s, just 0.6s off LOE. FOU was in fourth position on stage, 2.3s behind EVA and moved up two places to fourth overall. GRE was in fifth place on stage, 5.4s behind FOU dropped one place to fifth overall. NEU took sixth place on stage, 12.6s behind stage winner OGI and moved up one place to sixth overall. BRE was in seventh position on stage, with a time of 930.4s dropped two places to seventh overall. TÄN took eighth on stage, with a time of 933.1s and moved up one place to eighth overall. KAT was in ninth place on stage, 23.4s behind OGI and moved up one place to ninth overall. 2.3 Driver Report, SS2 - OGI OGI took the stage win and kept hold of the overall lead marking a time of 914.4s. These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 4.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times Chart Pace relative to the stage winner. 5.1.6 Ultimate Stage Comparisons Split time comparisons relative to various ultimate stage time calculations. These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 5.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times win and picked up one place to take the overall lead making a time of 656.8s. EVA took second on stage, 2.3s behind LOE and moved up one place to second overall. NEU was in third position on stage, with a time of 661.5s and moved up two places to fourth overall. TÄN took fourth place on stage, with a time of 662.4s and moved up one place to sixth overall, just 0.9s off NEU. KAT was in fifth place on stage, 6.5s further back behind TÄN . BRE took sixth on stage, 13.1s behind stage winner LOE in a time of 669.9s . OGI was in seventh place on stage, 2.7s behind BRE and dropped two places to lose the overall lead, falling back to third overall. GRE was in ninth on stage, with a time of 681.1s dropped three places to seventh overall, just 0.5s further behind OGI. ROV was in eleventh position on stage, 35.4s behind the stage winner and moved up one place to ninth overall, just 0.5s off GRE. 5.3 Driver Report, SS5 - OGI OGI was in seventh place on stage, 2.7s behind BRE and dropped two places to lose the overall lead, falling back to third overall. These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 6.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 7.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times OGI was in second on stage, 1.4s behind GRE and moved up one place to second overall. LOE took third position on stage, with a time of 454.8s and retained the overall lead. BRE took fourth place on stage, with a time of 454.8s with the same time as LOE. KAT took fifth on stage, 3.0s behind stage winner GRE and just 0.1s behind BRE. Pace relative to the stage winner. 8.1.6 Ultimate Stage Comparisons Split time comparisons relative to various ultimate stage time calculations. These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 8.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 9.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 10.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times the rally marking a time of 566.4s. EVA was in second position on stage, with a time of 567.5s . ROV took third place on stage, with a time of 571.6s and moved up two places to seventh overall. LOE took fourth on stage, 6.5s behind the stage winner and dropped one place to lose the overall lead, falling back to second overall. BRE took fifth position on stage, 11.1s behind the stage winner and moved up one place to fourth overall. TÄN took sixth position on stage, 4.7s further back behind BRE . NEU was in seventh place on stage, 24.7s behind the stage winner dropped one place to fifth overall. KAT was in eighth on stage, 4.5s further back behind NEU and moved up one place to sixth overall. GRE took eleventh on stage, 101.5s behind the stage winner in a time of 667.9s dropped three places to ninth overall. 10.3 Driver Report, SS10 - OGI OGI took the stage win and picked up one place to take the overall lead of the rally marking a time of 566.4s. Comparisons Split time comparisons relative to various ultimate stage time calculations. These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 11.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times 10 NA NA NA NA NA EVA Stage report for SS11: OGI recorded the stage win and retained the overall lead of the rally recording a time of 857.1s. ROV was in second on stage, with a time of 861.6s and moved up two places to fifth overall. BRE was in third on stage, with a time of 862.0s and moved up one place to third overall, just 0.4s off ROV. LOE was in fourth place on stage, 5.4s behind stage winner OGI in a time of 862.5s, just 0.5s off BRE. KAT took fifth on stage, 13.2s further back behind LOE . NEU was in seventh position on stage, 40.1s behind the stage winner in a time of 897.2s and moved up one place to fourth overall. TÄN was in eighth position on stage, 10.1s further back behind NEU and moved up one place to seventh overall. 11.3 Driver Report, SS11 - OGI OGI recorded the stage win and retained the overall lead of the rally recording a time of 857.1s. comparisons relative to various ultimate stage time calculations. These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 12.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times Stage Comparisons Split time comparisons relative to various ultimate stage time calculations. These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 13.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times to various ultimate stage time calculations. These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 14.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 15.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 16.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times various ultimate stage time calculations. These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 17.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times
